abstract: Nigeria signed a $3.1 billion deal with the local arm of Royal Dutch Shell on Monday to plug a funding gap in their joint venture projects, the country’s state oil firm NNPC said.
lead_paragraph: Nigeria signed a $3.1 billion deal with the local arm of Royal Dutch Shell on Monday to plug a funding gap in their joint venture projects, the country’s state oil firm NNPC said.

headline.main: Shell Ponies Up $3.1 Billion for Nigerian Joint Ventures
